issue.message: Attribute `android:inputType` should not be used with `<TextView>`: Change element type to `<EditText>` ?
Attribute `android:inputType` should not be used with `<TextView>`: Change element type to `<EditText>` ?
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
issue.errorLine1: txtSummary.setText(String.format("In this month, your total expenses is %d VND and your total income is %d VND.%n%s", sumExpense, sumIncome, tempText));

issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
issue.errorLine1: txtSummarySpecific.setText(String.format("For this month, you spent the most on %s. The spending on %s is %d VND. Reconsider agiain before spending on %s next time!", maxExpense, maxExpense, maxExpenseAmount, maxExpense));

issue.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the `android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES` javadoc for details.
